page.title: 09PUBLIC TRANSPORT
page.content: The public transport which people who live in Ilmington can use is only a very limited service.The main local bus route, to{Stratford,}used to be provided by the{Midland Red Bus {Company}and it was subsidised by the government and by the local authority.The coaches are now run by a private bus company,{The Meon Valley {Coach Company}operating from{ {Moreton-in-the-Marsh}.They run on Monday,Wednesday,Friday and Saturday to Stratford (fare=80p for an adult& child) and on Tuesday to Moreton-in-the-Marsh (fare=40p for an adult&child.Private hire journeys can be arranged.The majority of people who live in Ilmington have their own{cars} but there is also a private{taxi} service which operates from the village.
